title.narrative: ACCESIBILITY OF SOCIAL PROTECTION PROGRAMMES

description.narrative: Key social protection programmes for children and adolescents, primarily from the poorest households, are more accessible and more appropriate to their needs., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, child and adolescent malnutrition in all its forms is reduced, with a special focus on overweight and obesity.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Key social protection programmes for children and adolescents, primarily from the poorest households, are more accessible and moreappropriate to their needs.

description.narrative: Throughout 2021, UNICEF worked to expand social protection in Mexico both at federal and subnational levels. Such efforts were most fruitful at subnational level, especially with a promising engagement with the government of Mexico City. Specifically, UNICEF carried out an assessment of the cash transfer programmeMi Beca para Empezar, which benefits 1.2 million children and submitted a proposal to expand this programme to cover 400 thousand children under 5, currently being studied by the city government. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/01/2022
